result.execSummary:
The defendant John Junior Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit. If there is no posted bail, the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within 6 months of today's date. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment
Huber release privileges for work, AODA treatment and Batterer's Treatment (if enrolled). Defendant to report in no later than 05-08-2017. 2 days credit
Court advised the defendant he may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Junior Gray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order For Cancellation of Huber/ Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Kremers Br 36 for review. os

Defendant John Junior Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Justice Point report received and filed.
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work, AODA treatment and Batterer's Treatment (if enrolled) and 2 days credit.  Defendant to report in no later than 05/08/2017.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within 6 months of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Plea hearing continued, same appearances...
.
As to charge as amended:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Defendant has a pending case in Waukesha County.
Court ordered case adjourned for a sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date vacated.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Drug test violation to be addressed on next court date.

Defendant John Junior Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner, by phone.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court again for another positive THC test.  Court spoke to the defendant regarding his drug use.
Case remains calendared for a final pretrial date in Branch 36 on 04/11/2017 at 08:30 a.m..

Defendant John Junior Gray in court.  Attorney Hagner appeared by phone.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are on the record for a violation.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  The court admonished the defendant regarding his positive test and will look at changing bail if he tests positive again.
Attorney Hagner informed the court that the defendant will be changing his plea at the next court date.
Case remains calendared for a final pretrial on 04/11/2017 at  08:30 am.

Defendant John Junior Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Natahsa W. and Stephanie B.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Junior Gray in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant John Junior Gray in custody.  Mark P. Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
